poem:
Title: "In Civil Halls"

In the calm of capitol haze,
A clock strikes in congress, in a near-minute craze.
Legislation dispatched, late but searing,
A reprieve from the brink, government gearing.
Just two days, marked in sighs and looks,
To the man at the desk, cradled in books.
A potential silence, heart chilling,
Yet, a stopgap bill, the empty halls filling.
